intro: Cracca huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén cracca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to high altitudes and cool climates. Cracca huillensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
